# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia programming language:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, ' ') # split the string into words
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width - 1 # check if adding this word would exceed max width
            result *= "\n" # add a new line if it would exceed
        end
        result *= " $word" # append the word to the current line (with a space before)
    end
    return result
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a long string that will be wrapped"))
```

The output of this example would be:

```
This is a
long string 
that will 
be wrapped
```
